alert.note: Alert for Knott (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:49PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Letcher, southeastern Perry and southwestern Knott Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 449 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jeff, or near Hazard, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Vicco, Sassafras, Wiscoal, Anco, Elic, Arminta, Bluefield, Red Star, Ulvah and Hallie around 455 PM EDT. Letcher, Blackey, Cody, Smithsboro, Carr Creek, Dirk, Redfox, Littcarr, Gander and Carcassonne around 500 PM EDT. Bath, Sackett, Amelia, Colson, Isom, Spider, Tillie, Pine Top, Nealy and Jeremiah around 505 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Whitesburg, Lester, Lucastown, Polly, Southdown, Farraday, Winters, Crown, Sergent, Bellcraft, Craftsville, Seco, Whitaker, Millstone, Thornton and Wright. THIS INCLUDES Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 55 and 58. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
